intro: Strychnos vanprukii, commonly known as the Vanprukii strychnos, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya, where it grows in forested regions. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, followed by oval, woody fruits containing several seeds. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. While not widely cultivated, it holds ecological significance in its native habitat.
